title: Uber
summary: Uber Technologies, Inc., commonly known as Uber, is an American mobility as a service provider based in San Francisco, with operations in over 900 metropolitan areas worldwide.[3] Its services include ride-hailing, food delivery (Uber Eats and Postmates), package delivery, couriers, freight transportation,[6] electric bicycle and motorized scooter rental via a partnership with Lime,[7] and ferry transport in partnership with local operators.[8] Uber does not own any vehicles; instead, it receives a 25% commission from each booking.[9] Fares are quoted to the customer in advance but vary using a dynamic pricing model based on the local supply and demand at the time of the booking.[10]
